revised_title: Mathematical Theory of Stream- Lines and their Applications in Fluid Dynamics
tldr: The author investigates the mathematical properties of streamlines, focusing on those with four foci, and applies this theory to the study of fluid dynamics and naval architecture. The research is motivated by experiments conducted by William Froude on the resistance of model boats. The author finds that various shapes can be derived from four foci, which can be used to improve ship design and understand fluid flow patterns.
